metadict_description: Common meta info, not specific to any code

meta_info_entry.meta_description: (deprecated) Charge of each atom in the molecule.

meta_description: (deprecated) Name (label) of each atom in the
molecule.
(deprecated) Reference to the atom type of each atom in the
molecule.

meta_info_entry.meta_description: Atomic number Z of the atom.

meta_description: Species of the atom (normally the atomic number Z, 0 or negative for
unidentifed species or particles that are not
atoms.
(deprecated) Table mapping atom to molecules: the first column is the index of
the molecule and the second column the index of the atom, signifying that the
atom in the second column belongs to the molecule in the first column in the
same row.
List of the indexes involved in this constraint. The fist atom has index 1, the
last number_of_topology_atoms.
Short and unique name for this constraint type. Valid names are described in
the [constraint\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-met
a-info/wikis/metainfo/constraint-kind).
Explicit constraint parameters for this kind of constraint (depending on the
constraint type, some might be given implicitly through other
means).
Reference to the topological group of atoms which is used to define contraint
on it.
Type of DFT+U functional (such as DFT/DFT+U double-counting compensation).
Valid names are described in the [dft\_plus\_u\_functional wiki
page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/dft-p
lus-u-functional).
DFT+U-orbital setting: atom index (references index of
atom_labels/atom_positions)
DFT+U-orbital setting: value J (exchange
interaction)
DFT+U-orbital setting: orbital label (normally (n,l)), notation: '3d', '4f',
DFT+U-orbital setting: value U (on-site Coulomb
interaction)
DFT+U-orbital setting: value U_{effective} (U-J), if implementation uses
it
DFT+U: Type of orbitals used for projection in order to calculate occupation
numbers. Valid names are described in the [dft\_plus\_u\_projection\_type wiki
page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/dft-p
lus-u-projection-type).
Component of the correlation (C) energy at the GGA (or MetaGGA) level using the
self-consistent density of the target XC functional (full unscaled value, i.e.,
not scaled due to exact-exchange mixing).
Fermi energy (separates occupied from unoccupied single-particle states in
metals)
Fermi energy (separates occupied from unoccupied single-particle states in
metals) during the self-consistent field (SCF)
iterations.
Highest occupied single-particle state energy (in insulators or HOMO energy in
finite systems)
Highest occupied single-particle state energy (in insulators or HOMO energy in
finite systems) during the self-consistent field (SCF)
iterations.
Lowest unoccupied single-particle state energy (in insulators or LUMO energy in
finite systems)
Lowest unoccupied single-particle state energy (in insulators or LUMO energy in
finite systems) during the self-consistent field (SCF)
iterations.
Component of the exchange (X) energy at the GGA (or MetaGGA) level using the
self consistent density of the target functional (full unscaled value, i.e.,
not scaled due to exact-exchange mixing).
Component of the exchange (X) energy at the GGA (or MetaGGA) level, using the
self consistent density of the target functional, scaled accordingly to the
mixing parameter.
List of the indexes involved in this group. The fist atom has index 1, the last
number_of_topology_atoms.
Short and unique name for this group type. Valid names are described in the
[group\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wi
kis/metainfo/group-kind).
Cutoff type for the calculation of the bare Coulomb potential: none, 0d, 1d,
2d. See Rozzi et al., PRB 73, 205119 (2006)
Maximum G for the pw basis for the Coulomb
potential.
Auxillary basis set used for non-local operators: mixed - mixed basis set,
Kotani and Schilfgaarde, Solid State Comm. 121, 461
It specifies whether the core states are treated in the GW calculation: all -
All electron calculation; val - Valence electron only calculation; vab - Core
electrons are excluded from the mixed product basis; xal - All electron
treatment of the exchange self-energy only
Frequency integration grid type for the correlational self energy: 'eqdis' -
equidistant frequencies from 0 to freqmax; 'gaulag' - Gauss-Laguerre quadrature
from 0 to infinity; 'gauleg' - Gauss-Legendre quadrature from 0 to freqmax;
'gaule2' (default) - double Gauss-Legendre quadrature from 0 to freqmax and
from freqmax to infinity.
Number referring to the frequency used in the calculation of the self
energy.
Values of the frequency used in the calculation of the self
energy.
Weights of the frequency used in the calculation of the self
energy.
Maximum frequency for the calculation of the self
energy.
Cut-off parameter for the truncation of the expansion of the plane waves in the
interstitial region.
Maximum l value used for the radial functions within the
muffin-tin.
Eigenvalue threshold below which the egenvectors are discarded in the
construction of the radial basis set.

meta_info_entry.meta_description: k/q-point grid size used in the GW calculation.

meta_description: Number of frequency points used in the calculation of the self
energy.
Number of empty states used to compute the polarizability
P
Methods to solve the quasi-particle equation: 'linearization',
'self-consistent'
Model used to calculate the dinamically-screened Coulomb potential: 'rpa' -
Full-frequency random-phase approximation; 'ppm' - Godby-Needs plasmon-pole
model Godby and Needs, Phys. Rev. Lett. 62, 1169 (1989); 'ppm_hl' - Hybertsen
and Louie, Phys. Rev. B 34, 5390 (1986); 'ppm_lh' - von der Linden and P.
Horsh, Phys. Rev. B 37, 8351 (1988); 'ppm_fe' - Farid and Engel, Phys. Rev. B
47,15931 (1993); 'cdm' - Contour deformation method, Phys. Rev. B 67, 155208
Type of volume averaging for the dynamically screened Coulomb potential:
isotropic - Simple averaging along a specified direction using only diagonal
components of the dielectric tensor; anisotropic - Anisotropic screening by C.
Freysoldt et al., CPC 176, 1-13 (2007)
Diagonal matrix elements of the correlation
self-energy
Models for the correlation self-energy analytical continuation: 'pade' -
Pade's approximant (by H. J. Vidberg and J. W. Serence, J. Low Temp. Phys. 29,
179 (1977)); 'mpf' -  Multi-Pole Fitting (by H. N Rojas, R. W. Godby and R. J.
Needs, Phys. Rev. Lett. 74, 1827 (1995)); 'cd' - contour deformation; 'ra' -
real axis
Number of empty states to be used to calculate the correlation self
energy.

meta_info_entry.meta_description: Number of poles used in the analytical continuation.

meta_description: Treatment of the integrable singular terms in the calculation of the self
energy. Values: 'mpb' - Auxiliary function method by S. Massidda, M. Posternak,
and A. Baldereschi, PRB 48, 5058 (1993); 'crg' - Auxiliary function method by
P. Carrier, S. Rohra, and A. Goerling, PRB 75, 205126
Diagonal matrix elements of the exchange
self-energy
Exchange-correlation functional of the ground-state calculation. See
xc_functional list at https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wiki
s/metainfo/XC-functional
GW methodology: G0W0; ev-scGW: (eigenvalues self-consistent GW) – Phys.Rev.B
34, 5390 (1986); qp-scGW: (quasi-particle self-consistent GW) – Phys. Rev.
Lett. 96, 226402 (2006)  scGW0: (self-consistent G with fixed W0) – Phys.Rev.B
54, 8411 (1996); scG0W: (self-consistent W with fixed G0); scGW:
(self-consistent GW) – Phys. Rev. B 88, 075105

meta_info_entry.meta_description: Diagonal matrix elements of the exchange-correlation potential

meta_description: List of the indexes involved in this interaction. The fist atom has index 1,
the last atom index number_of_topology_atoms.
Short and unique name for this interaction type. Valid names are described in
the [interaction\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-me
ta-info/wikis/metainfo/interaction-kind).
Explicit interaction parameters for this kind of interaction (depending on the
interaction_kind some might be given implicitly through other
means).
Reference to the topological group of atoms which is used to define contraint
on it.

meta_info_entry.meta_description: Reference to a cell-associated basis set.

meta_description: String describing the use of the basis set, i.e, if it used for expanding a
wavefunction or an electron density. Allowed values are listed in the
[basis\_set\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-in
fo/wikis/metainfo/basis-set-kind).
Reference to an atom-centered basis set defined in
section_basis_set_atom_centered and to the atom kind as defined in
section_method_atom_kind.
Reference to an atom-centered basis set defined in
section_basis_set_atom_centered and to the atom kind as defined in
section_method_atom_kind.
Reference to the topology and force fields to be
used.
(deprecated) List of the indexes involved in this constraint. The fist atom has
index 1, the last index is number_of_atoms_in_molecule.
(deprecated) Short and unique name for this constraint type. Valid names are
described in the [constraint\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-
lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/constraint-kind).
(deprecated) Explicit constraint parameters for this kind of constraint
(depending on the constraint type some might be given implicitly through other
means).
(deprecated) List of the indexes involved in this bonded interaction within a
molecule. The first atom has index 1, the last index is
number_of_atoms_in_.
(deprecated) Short and unique name for this interaction type, used for bonded
interactions for atoms in a molecule. Valid names are described in the
[interaction\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-i
nfo/wikis/metainfo/interaction-kind).
(deprecated) Explicit interaction parameters for this kind of interaction
(depending on the interaction type some might be given implicitly through other
means), used for bonded interactions for atoms in a
molecule.
(deprecated) Mapping from molecules to molecule
types.

meta_info_entry.meta_description: (deprecated) Number of atoms in this molecule.
Number of atoms involved in this constraint.
Number of atoms involved in this group.
Number of atoms involved in this interaction.

meta_description: (deprecated) Number of atoms, in this molecule, involved in this
constraint.
(deprecated) Number of atoms, in this molecule, involved in this
interaction.
String describing the use of the basis set, i.e, if it used for expanding a
wavefunction or an electron density. Allowed values are listed in the
[basis\_set\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-in
fo/wikis/metainfo/basis-set-kind).

meta_info_entry.meta_description: Number of constraints of this type.
Number of groups of this type.
Number of interactions of this type.

meta_description: (deprecated) Number of constraints of this
type.
(deprecated) Number of bonded interactions of this
type.
Number of atoms in the system described by this
topology.
(deprecated) Number of molecules in the system, as described by this
topology.
The top level context containing the reponse to an api query, when using
jsonAPI they are tipically in the meta part
Message outputted by the program formatting the data in the current
format

meta_info_entry.meta_description: How many times this message was repeated

meta_description: level of the message: 0 fatal, 1 error, 2 warning, 3
debug

meta_info_entry.meta_description: Section describing an atom in the system.

meta_description: (deprecated) Section describing a type of atom in the
system.
Section describing a constraint between arbitrary
atoms.
Section describing a constraint between arbitrary
atoms.

meta_info_entry.meta_description: Section for DFT+U-settings of a single orbital

meta_description: Section describing a group (pairs, angles, molecules, etc.) between arbitrary
atoms.
Section containing the description of a bonded interaction between arbitrary
atoms.
This section contains the definition of the basis sets that are defined
independently of the atomic configuration.
(deprecated) Section describing a constraint between atoms within a
molecule.
(deprecated) Section describing a bonded interaction between atoms within a
molecule.
(deprecated) Section describing a type of molecule in the
system.
Messages outputted by the program formatting the data in the current
response

meta_info_entry.meta_description: Stores a soap descriptor for this configuration.

meta_description: Stores the soap coefficients for the pair of atoms given in
soap_coefficients_atom_pair.
Section containing the definition of topology (connectivity among atoms) of a
system.
(deprecated) Parameters of an atom within a
molecule.

meta_info_entry.meta_description: Some parameters that describe a constraint
Some parameters that describe a bonded interaction.

meta_description: A meta info whose corresponding data has been
shortened
Reference to the constraints used for this
system.

meta_info_entry.meta_description: Reference to the topology used for this system.

meta_enum_description: Uses spherical harmonics for the angular

meta_description: Compressed coefficient of the soap descriptor for the atom pair
soap_coefficients_atom_pair

meta_info_entry.meta_description: Pair of atoms described in the current section

meta_description: Unique checksum of all the soap parameters (all those with abstract type
soap_parameter) with prefix psoap
(deprecated) A unique string idenfiying the force field defined in this
section. Strategies to define it are discussed in the
[topology\_force\_field\_name](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-
info/wikis/metainfo/topology-force-field-name).
Reference to the topology used for this system; if not given, the trivial
topology should be assumed.
